contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Kōno'''|河野村|Kōno-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Nanjō District, Fukui|Nanjō District]], [[Fukui Prefecture|Fukui]], [[Japan]]. On January 1, 2005 Kōno was merged with the towns of [[Imajō, Fukui|Imajō]] and [[Nanjō, Fukui|Nanjō]], all from [[Nanjō District, Fukui|Nanjō District]], to form the new town of [[Minamiechizen, Fukui|Minamiechizen]]. As of this merger, the town of Nanjō no longer exists as an independent [[municipality of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 2,114 and a [[population density|density]] of 42.72 persons per km². The total area was 49.48 km². ==External links== *[http://www.town.minamiechizen.fukui.jp/ Official website of Minamiechizen] {{ja icon}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kono, Fukui}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Fukui Prefecture]] {{Fukui-geo-stub}}
